SENIOR TECHNICAL DESIGNER

SUMMARY

Product Developer/Technical Designer with strengths in apparel, handbags and jewelry.
I have an extensive knowledge of materials, manufacturing and quality assurance.
Dynamic product engineer highly skilled in creative problem solving with exceptional collaborative and interpersonal skills, who illustrates sophisticated expertise in a variety of innovative approaches, to design, prototype and test creative products, services and experiences.
I thrive working within a team environment and I have extensive experience working in partnership with domestic and international teams.

SKILLS

Adobe CS6 Adobe Illustrator Flex PLM Grovesite WebPDM Microsoft Word Excel Optitex Garment specs and sketches Fit Assessment Product Development Technical Direction, Line and Product Review Flat Pattern Making and Corrections Garment Construction Draping

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Events and Networking Pillar Lead on the LGBTA Business
Council.
Participant in BullseyeCrowd: an innovation execution platform to develop a place where anyone at Target can share their ideas and get access to the resources to turn their ideas into reality.to provide new market potential for Target.

Creation of samples from a sketch while maintaining the integrity of the design concept.
Provide technical solution support relevant to design.
Ensure products are engineered to cost standards and negotiated through order placement.
Provide technical direction, internally and externally, on corrective actions needed to bring samples to brand standards.
Utilize written comments, sketches or photos as needed to communicate.
Share information cross divisionally to ensure continuous implementation of best practices.
Execute placement of adopted styles in accordance with the sourcing strategy.

Manage work in progress, tracking and reporting for product development.
Identify efficiencies within my brand/category to support CTM initiative.

Manage team of 2 - Associate Technical Designer and Product Development Coordinator.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Sweater Designer

Location: New York, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
Job title: Sweater Designer

Contract type:

Location: New York

Discipline:

Remote: No

Salary: $80,000/year - $100,00/year

Reference: 463630

Contact name: Sarah Stanley

Job Description

Designer, Women's Sweaters

Client Overview: 

Our client is a celebrated authority in the design and manufacturing of women's clothing. The company is known for its popular brands which are featured in major retailers including Nordstrom, Bloomingdales, Macyâ€™s, Urban Outfitters, and more.

Designer Overview:

As the Sweater Designer, you will be responsible for supporting the Design Director by designing brand right collections to reflect season trends and account needs.

Designer Responsibilities:


 Research the market and put together market/trend research on new silhouettes,


color, and fabrication.


 Work closely with the Design Directors to execute their brand vision Track and organize development samples by following up with factories to ensure


samples are received on time.


 Design, sketch with accurate specifications for fit, construction, fabrication, print, and


color.


 Ensures adherence to the Seasonal Time and Action calendar Source and select the new seasonal fabrics and trims Work closely with suppliers abroad to ensure good execution of design tech packs


and samples


 Maintain the fabric, trim and color library - Ensure fabric library is up to date for


seasonal inspiration and archived fabrics

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills:


 Possess strong knowledge of garment construction. Experience in Sweaters Thorough knowledge of silhouettes, fabrication, construction techniques, and trim Ability to design around concept direction Strong sketching and fast tech packing abilities


Designer Qualifications:


 Level of education: Bachelor's degree in fashion design Work experience: 5+ years design experience- PRIVATE LABEL AND/OR OFF PRICE EXPERIENCE IS PREFERRED Creativity and enthusiasm for fashion Strong organizational skills Ability to multitask, prioritize workloads and handle the pressure of a fast-paced


environment


 Team player with a can-do attitude Proficient in Photoshop, Illustrator, Excel and all other Microsoft Office Applications

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
